SWAB(3) Library Functions Manual SWAB(3)

NAME

swab — swap adjacent bytes

LIBRARY

Standard C Library (libc, -lc)

SYNOPSIS

#include <unistd.h>

void
swab(const void *restrict src, void *restrict dest, ssize_t nbytes);

DESCRIPTION

The function swab() copies nbytes bytes from the location referenced by src to the location referenced by dest, swapping adjacent bytes.

The argument nbytes should be an even number. If nbytes is odd, swab() copies and exchanges nbytes -1 bytes and the disposition of the last byte is unspecified. If copying takes place between objects that overlap, the behavior is undefined. If nbytes is negative, swab() does nothing.

SEE ALSO

bzero(3), memset(3), compat(5)

HISTORY

A swab() function appeared in Version 7 AT&T UNIX.

February 24, 2010 macOS 15.6
